bibl.title: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Jefferson Randolph Kean, January 26, 1937

div1.p: Truby writes to Kean concerning identification of the men in a photograph of the Detachment of the Hospital Corps at Camp Columbia, Cuba.

div1.head: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Jefferson Randolph Kean, January 26, 1937

opener.dateline:
145 Laurel Street
San Francisco, California
Jan. 26, 1937

div1.p:
I have been waiting to complete the
identification of the men in the photo, of
the detachment at Camp Columbia, before
answering your letter of Dec 14th I think
we have it nearly correct and so have
written the Curator of the Museum to make some
mounted copies of the photograph and paste
the list on the back. I asked him to send
you, General Ireland and others a copy.
He will also furnish the library with
one or more copies. Capt. England and
Sontag were of great help in identifying
the men.

You suggested sending your copy of the
photograph to Moran. I think he would be
glad to have it and I will inclose copies
of my list which you could send with the
photo.

It was nice of you, Ireland to take
old man Cor to the Club for lunch. I
got a line from him quite frequently.
He was a patient at the Walter Reed Hospital
AC
Tr
lately, but did not remain there long-
I expect he was hard to handle and
not happy out there.

We are all well and happy. This is
by all odds the best place to live in that I
know of. However, I would have been
happy in Washington if I had had something
to do that would have added a little to
my income.

I hope that you and Mrs. Kean are
well. Mrs Truby joins me in love
and best wishes for you both-
